title: Lux's W shielding her instantly is okay in my opinion.
body:
But please, don't go through those E buffs

She'll be WAY too oppressive with it, as any good Lux player will always land it correctly (even now, it's almost impossible to dodge, unless you got mobility)

Give her something if you want, like a small mana regen buff or something, but please, don't go through with that Lux E change.

> [{quoted}](name=Cindikle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EKVduWen,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-06-12T01:11:55.317+0000)

> The E change is to make her not so ping dependent. 
> 
> If it really becomes a problem we'll probably see a small damage drop off at the edges.

The ping dependency change here is the big one. At present players on extremely low ping have a really reliable detonation already. Those on moderate to high pings however aren't able to pull off those same plays where the E detonates almost instantly after landing. Higher ping's already a significant disadvantage, so we'd like to diminish any unneeded costs where we can.

It is possible this will make Lux's E too reliable, since there'll be a bit of benefit here even for players with no significant ping at all. If so we'd probably look at reducing the explosion radius a bit as a result to restore the spell to its previous best case reliability profile.

I'm a big Lux player by myself, and I think she's fine already. And she will be fine after those changes, it's ofc a small buff, but it's mostly a QoL change. E was nearly impossible to miss before anyway, and the shield was extremly clunky before.

Why are people even trying to get Lux buffs anyways? She's pretty much one of the safest midlaners, has long range, can zone well, has a good amount of cc and zoning ability, and has pretty good damage. She also has clearly identifiable weaknesses such as lack of mobility, high cooldowns, and high mana costs. According to champion.gg shes sitting at a 50.01% winrate, which seems to indicate she's pretty balanced. It also states she's in the upper half rankings for mid lane, which further suggests she doesn't need any buffs. What's the deal?

1) She's no real waveclear so it's easy to percieve her as weak. Also the one ability in her kit which is the main spell for both farm and poke also has prohibitively high mana costs (30 higher than the standard for ultimates at max rank). 

2) Her comboing is clunky since it involves hitting multiple skillshots and interleaving autoattacks. Her AA range also forces her to make good use of that shield to survive.

Hence why people are constantly asking for mana cost reductions on her E. Because it's the clunkiest part of her kit, and because she sticks out among similar mages (like Orianna or Syndra) as not being able to clear the caster minions in one combination of ability use (on top of that her E costs about the same amount of mana as most similar combos, but unlike such combos (Orianna's Q+W, Syndra's Q+W, Morgana's W) fails to clear the caster minions most of the time, even with proccing her passive afterwards). Her E also doesn't carry all that much damage by itself, because while it deals a lot of damage Lux has a lot of her damage bound up in her passive, which she can't proc at E-poke range.

Overall she's probably quite balanced, her ult is fairly strong, her combo is pretty damn great when she can get it off, and she is a combo mage with an AoE shield which refreshes itself slightly after cast.

---

Asking for these kinds of relatively minor, mostly QoL, buffs impacting mostly her clunkiness is much more sensible than asking for real buffs (like more dmg vs minions on her E, or longer attack range to proc her passive better, or lower mana cost on her E which can't even clear caster minions).

And buffs which increase playability and clarity of play are more important to get out there than straight up balance issues.

I don't care if pre-detonating her E makes her OP, or if her shield coming up slightly earlier makes her nearly unkillable. Because at least as a player it's easier to know when your abilities go off.

Some ISPs do throttle traffic.  They specifically target traffic that comes from companies that provide services that rival their own services (think Comcast and Time Warner throttling anything related to online TV/music).  They also charge inflated rates for co-location of servers if those servers would make a rival service more appealing than their own.  Not all ISPs do this, though, only the ones that have been propped up in their government sponsored monopolies for years with little to no oversight on their activities.

As for the original trollness, yes it sounds like Riot is co-locating servers across a bunch of ISPs.  It should make the ping times very fast for everyone, since the receipt of the data packets will be sub-10 ms (however long it takes to get to your ISP's data center) and the servers won't be bottlenecked on their client side communications anymore.
